result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan F Bustamante Orozco

records.addlTxt: Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:52 AM Defendant Juan F Bustamante Orozco in court.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Juan F Bustamante Orozco. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense indicates that there was a bad WCS letter, and that is why the Defendant appears today. Interpreter was not scheduled, as an authorization was previously filed. 

Defense states that SCRAM amount would be paid in 2 weeks, and that payment arrangements are going to be made. Defense requests SCRAM to be removed. Defendant is in the process of completing program. 

State requests that a bail motion be filed. 

Defense is unsure re: status of completion of counseling. 

Court will set for further proceeding date.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 09/23/2022 received and filed.

WCS Noncompliance Report

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 09/23/2022 - Will address in Court on 09/26.**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Juan F Bustamante Orozco in court with attorney Pablo Galaviz. 
Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  in person.  Sworn In.
Court to Address:  Active Warrant - Non-Compliance with WCS.

Court will continue the court appointment of 21CM1233 to include 22CM1141.  
Court quashes the warrant.

Attorney Galaviz presented arguments to the court regarding his client's non-compliance with WCS.
Court admonished the defendant - No further action taken.  
Court orders the defendant to report to WCS following court to get the SCRAM monitor re-installed.

No interpreter will be needed for the next court date.  Attorney will be appearing by authorization.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Body ONLY/Branch 6 ONLY
Warrant issued for WCS non-compliance - failure to make payment for SCRAM CAM monitoring.
EXT Code #3

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 7/20/2022 received and filed.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 7/20/2022 - A Branch 6 only warrant will issue due to the non-payment.**

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 07/18/2022 received and filed.
**Reviewed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on 7/19/2022 - The Court will address this at the next hearing.**
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, signed by Judge Brad D. Schimel on June 29th, 2022.
Hearing on July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.    Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Court is adding level 2.

01:54 PM Defendant Juan F Bustamante Orozco in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dawn Maldondo appearing by zoom video.    Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Court will extend the appointment of counsel to this case the payment arrangement of $50.00 per month will remain and cover both cases.  Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
WCS Pre-trial Report
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
